items.title: Scientists uncover the secret triggers of ‘impossible’ earthquakes
bullets: • Scientists uncover the secret triggers of ‘impossible’ earthquakes

• Once considered geologically impossible, earthquakes in stable regions like Utah and Groningen can actually occur due to long-inactive faults that slowly “heal” and strengthen over millions of years
• When reactivated, these faults release all that built-up stress in one powerful event before stabilizing again

• Timed links may also be added to episodes automatically whenever creators mention another podcast
• The features will arrive in iOS 26.2, which is currently in developer beta testing

• But perhaps the Corsair brand found a workaround?

bullets: • MAI-Image-1 is Microsoft’s first in-house AI image generator

items.title: Nomad’s magnetic charging stands now support faster 25W rates
bullets: • Nomad’s magnetic charging stands now support faster wireless charging rates of up to 25W
• The Stand One and Stand One Max hubs are made from a mix of glass and CNC-machined aluminum
• A braided USB-C cable is included, but each requires you to supply your own 40W charger
• The new version of the Stand One is available now for $119 in silver or carbide colors

items.title: Amazon and Perplexity have kicked off the great AI web browser fight
bullets: • Amazon says it has ‘repeatedly requested’ that Perplexity stop allowing its AI-powered browser to purchase products for customers
• The AI browser, Comet, currently offers an agentic AI feature that can find and purchase products from various websites — including Amazon — on your behalf
• Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said last week that he expects to “partner with third-party agents” over time

items.title: Why Trump hijacked the .gov domain
bullets: • Donald Trump's vicious, meme-driven ethos has started seeping into the US government’s official internet presence
• The federal government shutdown, as of today, is tied for the longest shutdown in history
• Back in 2018, two things were constantly in my social media diet: viral videos from WorldStarHipHop.com of people getting into physical fights
